meanings.definition: Extremely large or great in amount
meanings.sent1: The elephant was tremendously big compared to the mouse.
meanings.sent2: The mountain was tremendously tall, reaching high into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The cake was tremendously huge, enough to feed the whole neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was tremendously bright, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The tree in the forest was tremendously old, standing for centuries.

meanings.definition: In a very impressive or awe-inspiring manner
meanings.sent1: She sang tremendously well at the concert, impressing everyone.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display was tremendously beautiful, lighting up the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed his tricks tremendously, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: The athlete ran tremendously fast, breaking the world record.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved across the stage tremendously gracefully, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: To a very great extent or degree
meanings.sent1: He tremendously enjoyed the movie, laughing throughout.
meanings.sent2: The students worked tremendously hard to prepare for the exam.
meanings.sent3: The chef tremendously seasoned the dish, making it too salty.
meanings.sent4: The storm tremendously affected the coastal town, causing flooding.
meanings.sent5: The singer tremendously improved her voice with practice, impressing her fans.
